name: Harvard University
uniqueFact: Harvard is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States, founded in 1636.
description: A prestigious Ivy League university known for its rigorous academics and influential alumni.

name: Stanford University
uniqueFact: Stanford's campus is one of the largest in the world, spanning over 8,000 acres.
description: A leading research university known for its innovation and proximity to Silicon Valley.

name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
uniqueFact: MIT has produced 96 Nobel laureates, among the highest of any university.
description: A world-renowned institution focused on science, engineering, and technology.

name: California Institute of Technology (Caltech)
uniqueFact: Caltech manages the Jet Propulsion Laboratory for NASA.
description: A small but highly prestigious university specializing in science and engineering.

name: Princeton University
uniqueFact: Princeton is one of the few universities to offer a no-loan financial aid policy.
description: An Ivy League university known for its strong emphasis on undergraduate education.

name: Yale University
uniqueFact: Yale's secret societies, like Skull and Bones, are famous worldwide.
